thread.title: Area Roundup 10-24-15: Serrano girls finish fifth in Mt. SAC sweepstakes race
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 10-24-15: Serrano girls finish fifth in Mt. SAC sweepstakes race

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 10-24-15: Serrano girls finish fifth in Mt. SAC sweepstakes race
text: Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 11:20 PM Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 11:20 PM » Social News WALNUT — The Serrano girls cross country team took fifth place in the sweepstakes race at the Mt. SAC Invitational on Saturday. The Diamondbacks were second among Division 2 teams. They finished behind Great Oak, Davis and Arcadia, which are the top three Div. 1 teams in the state, and Saugus, which is ranked first in Div. 2. Bella Vista, which was ranked first in Div. 2 for most of the season, finished one spot behind the D’backs in sixth. Courtney Brenner led Serrano, taking 17th in 17 minutes, 58 seconds. Summer Barkan finished 26th in 18:14, and Kelly Fairchild was two spots back in 18:18. Serrano’s boys took fourth in the Div. 1 race, led by Jhavahn Holston’s sixth-place finish in 16:09. Tyler Barnes was Serrano’s next finisher, taking 26th in 16:52. The D’backs run in the Arcadia Invitational on Oct. 30. Serrano Boys 6. Holston 16:09; 26. Barnes 16:52; 33. Moran 17:00; 39. Griffin 17:11; 51. Vasek 17:24. Serrano Girls 17. C. Brenner 17:58; 26. Barkan 18:14; 28. Fairchild 18:18; 45. Cornell 18:50; 68. J. Brenner 19:14. Prep Cross Country Sun Devils’ La Rue finishes ninth At Walnut, Apple Valley’s Alex La Rue medaled and the boys took seventh place at the Mt. SAC Invitational. La Rue finished ninth in Division 2 with a time of 17:06. Darla Gonzalez took home the best time of the fourth-place girls squad. She placed 24th in 21:16. Apple Valley next competes in the Mojave River League finals at Victor Valley College on Nov. 4. Apple Valley Boys 9. A. La Rue 17:06; 31. Solis 17:54; 40. Pompa 18:17; 41. C. La Rue 18:19; 42. Bedolla 18:21. Apple Valley Girls 24. Gonzalez 21:16; 26. Cox 21:19; 27. Hendrix 21:31; 28. Calderon 21:36; 43. McBain 22.28. Prep Football Hesperia Christian 44, California Lutheran 38 At Hesperia, the Patriots fell behind by two touchdowns early but came back to win an Agape League game Friday night. Hesperia Christian quarterback Austin Luton completed 8 of 12 passes for 123 yards and two touchdowns and also ran for 82 yards and two TDs. Zach Shilling ran for a team-high 147 yards and added a TD. Trevor Bragg ran for 73 yards and caught five passes for 86 yards and a TD, while Hunter Dobyns added two catches for 87 yards and a TD. Quentin Wilson returned a kickoff 79 yards for a touchdown. Luton had 12 tackles on defense, Dobyns had eight tackles and a fumble recovery, Jacob Hooper had 11 tackles and David Hough had a sack to end the game. The Patriots (5-2, 1-1 AL) finish the regular season at Upland Christian on Thursday. A win would give them a share of the league title. Cal Lu 18 8 0 12 — 38 HCS 16 6 14 8 — 44 First Quarter C — Aguilar 35 pass from Schriefer (run failed) C — Dobson 44 run (run failed) H — Dobyns 15 pass from Luton (Shilling run) C — Schriefer 2 run (run failed) H — Wilson 79 kickoff return (Bragg pass from Luton) Second Quarter C — Bailes 18 pass from Schriefer (Schriefer run) H — Bragg 25 pass from Luton (run failed) Third Quarter H — Luton 6 run (Luton run) H — Luton 3 run (run failed) Fourth Quarter C — Schriefer 3 run (run failed) H — Shilling 8 run (Wilson run) C — Bailes 70 yard pass from Schriefer (run failed) By Staff Reports
